definitions: The reduction in the amount of ozone in the stratosphere, caused by the release of chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) and other pollutants.
The process by which the ozone layer is gradually thinned, allowing more ultraviolet radiation to reach the Earth's surface.
examples: Ozone depletion is a global environmental concern.
International efforts aim to combat ozone depletion.
The Montreal Protocol addresses ozone depletion.
